newsitem.title: USA: HOT STOCKS HIGHLIGHTS - U.S. Corporate Earnings.
newsitem.headline: HOT STOCKS HIGHLIGHTS - U.S. Corporate Earnings.

text.p: MICROSOFT CORP up seven at 105-1/8 to 103-7/8.

The Redmond, Wash-based software giant reported third quarter earnings of $0.79 a share Thursday after the close of trading, well above consensus forecasts of $0.64 a share. In reaction, analysts at Goldman Sachs, Hambrecht & Quist and SoundView Financial raised their fiscal year 1997 and 1998 earnings per share estimates on the company.
Late Thursday the Mountain View, Calif., computer graphics systems company reported third quarter earnings of $0.09 a share before charges, under the consensus forecast of $0.27 a share.
Salomon Brothers, Goldman Sachs and J.P. Morgan Securities downgraded their ratings on Silicon Graphics.

The Stoughton, Mass.-based footwear company late Thursday reported first quarter earnings of $0.69, above consensus estimate of $0.65. But executives said the company will not make share repurchases in the near term and SG&A spending will rise in 1997 over 1996 levels.

The Alexander City, Ala.-based maker of leisure apparel and athletic uniforms reported first quarter earnings of $0.30 a share on Friday, below consensus expectations of $0.34. J.P. Morgan Securities downgraded the stock and cut its 1997 earnings estimate, citing weak sales.
The Norwalk, Conn.-bases medical device company reported first quarter earnings late Thursday of $0.39 a share, which beat the Wall Street consensus estimate of $0.37.
DESKTOP DATA INC tumbled 5-3/4 to six.

The Burlington, Mass company which delivers real-time news and information said late Thursday it expects revenue growth for full 1997 to be in the 23 percent to 25 percent range, compared with 46 percent in 1996 "and less than we anticipated previously." Alex. Brown downgraded the stock.

The Westbrook, Maine-based biotechnology company said on Friday its second-quarter financial results are unlikely to exceed those reported for the first quarter, due to lower sales of certain products and the completion of its inventory reduction program. IDEXX reported first-quarter net income of $0.02 per share, compared with $0.18 for the same period a year ago.
The San Jose, Calif.-based semiconductor company posted late Thursday first quarter earnings of $0.04 a share, down from $0.18 a year ago.
